New Records: Gabon has a strong historical record against Lesotho, winning three and drawing one of their four previous encounters.
Key Match Events: Lesotho is on a six-match winless streak, while Gabon has won their last three home matches.
Pre-Game Insights: Gabon aims for back-to-back wins, while Lesotho seeks their first points in the qualifying campaign. The match is significant for both teams due to their historical performance and current form.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is held at the new Stade de Franceville, and Lesotho has included five new players in their provisional squad, including a debutant.
Others: Gabon's front three of Aubameyang, Babicka, and Bouanga is expected to lead their attack, while Lesotho's attack will be led by Sera Motebang, who scored their only goal in the qualifiers so far.
